name: A structured representation of individuals' life histories, detailing personal information, educational and career trajectories, significant life events, relationships, and affiliations, each contextualized with temporal and spatial attributes to provide a comprehensive overview of a person's life journey.

classes.name: Thing
classes.description: The most general class of entities in the ontology, serving as the single root of the hierarchy.

usage_guideline.description: Use as the universal superclass for all ontology classes to ensure a single-root hierarchical structure.
usage_guideline.constraints: All classes must be direct or indirect subclasses of Thing

classes.name: PersonLifeEvent
classes.description: Represents significant events occurring in an individual's life such as marriage, divorce, childbirth, adoption, health crises, migration, or retirement.

usage_guideline.description: Use to categorize and model distinct life events associated with a person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Each instance must have a temporal and locational context if available

classes.name: GeographicLocation
classes.description: Represents a physical place relevant to a person's life events, including residences, workplaces, schools, migration waypoints, and sites of significant events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify locations tied to life events or movements of persons.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be linked to PersonLifeEvent or Person instances via object properties

classes.name: FamilyRelationship
classes.description: Represents the type of familial relationship between persons such as parent, child, sibling, spouse, extended, adoptive, step, and chosen family.

usage_guideline.description: Use to define relationship roles within a family network of persons.
usage_guideline.constraints: Model as either classes or detailed object properties depending on relation complexity

classes.name: LifeStatus
classes.description: Represents sequential or overlapping statuses or conditions in a person's life that can be temporally bounded and visualized on a timeline.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model periods or conditions affecting a person's life (e.g., employment status, health conditions).
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be associated with temporal data

classes.name: FamilyMember
classes.description: Represents a person who is a member of an individual's family network.

usage_guideline.description: Use for persons related through any familial relationship to the subject person.
usage_guideline.constraints: Linked via FamilyRelationship properties

classes.name: MigrationPathway
classes.description: Represents a sequence or path of GeographicLocations traversed by a Person during migration.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model geographic movement patterns of a person over time.
usage_guideline.constraints: Should be linked to Person and ordered sequence of GeographicLocations

classes.name: Person
classes.description: Represents an individual human being with personal, familial, and life event attributes.

usage_guideline.description: Use as the central class for individuals in the ontology.
usage_guideline.constraints: Serves as domain for personal relations and events

classes.name: UncertaintyRepresentation
classes.description: Represents the modeling of uncertainty or incomplete information in a person's life history or events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent cases where life history data is incomplete, disrupted, or uncertain, enabling explicit modeling of unknown or uncertain aspects.
usage_guideline.constraints: Instances should be linked to PersonLifeEvent or other relevant classes to specify uncertain information.

classes.name: TemporalOrderingRelation
classes.description: Represents a temporal ordering or overlap relationship between two PersonLifeEvents or LifeStatus instances, indicating concurrency or sequence.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model temporal relationships such as ordering, concurrency, or overlap between life events or statuses in an individual's life history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Connects temporally related event or status instances.

classes.name: UncertaintyRepresentation
classes.description: Represents the modeling of uncertainty or incomplete information in a person's life history or events.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent cases where life history data is incomplete, disrupted, or uncertain, enabling explicit modeling of unknown or uncertain aspects.
usage_guideline.constraints: Instances should be linked to PersonLifeEvent or other relevant classes to specify uncertain information.

classes.name: TemporalOrderingRelation
classes.description: Represents a temporal ordering or overlap relationship between two PersonLifeEvents or LifeStatus instances, indicating concurrency or sequence.

usage_guideline.description: Use to model temporal relationships such as ordering, concurrency, or overlap between life events or statuses in an individual's life history.
usage_guideline.constraints: Connects temporally related event or status instances.

object_properties.name: hasFamilyMember
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to another Person who is a member of their family network.

usage_guideline.description: Use to connect persons with their family members; asymmetric because family relation directions are not bidirectional for this property conceptually.
usage_guideline.constraints: Domain is Person; Range is FamilyMember

object_properties.name: hasFamilyRelationship
object_properties.description: Relates two Persons with a specific type of familial relationship.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the nature of family ties between individuals.
usage_guideline.constraints: Assumes each pair has at most one primary family relationship type

object_properties.name: hasLifeEvent
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to a PersonLifeEvent they experienced.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate persons with their life events.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple life events possible per person

object_properties.name: occurredAtLocation
object_properties.description: Relates a PersonLifeEvent to the GeographicLocation where it occurred.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link life events to their locations; functional assuming one primary location per event.
usage_guideline.constraints: Domain is PersonLifeEvent, Range is GeographicLocation

object_properties.name: hasLifeStatus
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to a LifeStatus describing a temporal condition or state.

usage_guideline.description: Use to represent statuses or conditions experienced by a person over time.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple statuses may apply and overlap temporally

object_properties.name: livedAtLocation
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to a GeographicLocation representing a place of residence during a time period.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link persons to places they resided; temporal qualifiers handled via additional properties or related classes.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple residences possible; not necessarily functional

object_properties.name: workedAtLocation
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to a GeographicLocation representing a workplace.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link persons to their places of employment.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple workplaces possible

object_properties.name: studiedAtLocation
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to a GeographicLocation representing an educational institution attended.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link persons to schools or educational locations.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple schools possible

object_properties.name: hasMigrationPathway
object_properties.description: Relates a Person to their MigrationPathway representing geographic movements over time.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link a person with a single migration pathway summarizing geographic movement.
usage_guideline.constraints: Assumes one primary migration pathway per person

object_properties.name: hasUncertainty
object_properties.description: Relates an entity such as a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus to its UncertaintyRepresentation describing uncertainty or incompleteness of information.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate life events or statuses with their uncertainty representations when data is incomplete or disrupted.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple uncertainties may apply; domain includes events or statuses where uncertainty can be relevant.

object_properties.name: hasTemporalOrderingRelation
object_properties.description: Relates a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus to another temporally related PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus describing their temporal ordering or overlap.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link an event or status to a temporal ordering relation indicating overlap or sequencing with other events or statuses.
usage_guideline.constraints: Functional property assuming one primary temporal ordering relation per event or status.

object_properties.name: relatesToEventOrStatus
object_properties.description: Relates a TemporalOrderingRelation to a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus that it orders or relates temporally.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the events or statuses involved in a TemporalOrderingRelation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Typically links two distinct events or statuses to describe temporal ordering or overlap.

object_properties.name: hasUncertainty
object_properties.description: Relates an entity such as a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus to its UncertaintyRepresentation describing uncertainty or incompleteness of information.

usage_guideline.description: Use to associate life events or statuses with their uncertainty representations when data is incomplete or disrupted.
usage_guideline.constraints: Multiple uncertainties may apply; domain includes events or statuses where uncertainty can be relevant.

object_properties.name: hasTemporalOrderingRelation
object_properties.description: Relates a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus to another temporally related PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus describing their temporal ordering or overlap.

usage_guideline.description: Use to link an event or status to a temporal ordering relation indicating overlap or sequencing with other events or statuses.
usage_guideline.constraints: Functional property assuming one primary temporal ordering relation per event or status.

object_properties.name: relatesToEventOrStatus
object_properties.description: Relates a TemporalOrderingRelation to a PersonLifeEvent or LifeStatus that it orders or relates temporally.

usage_guideline.description: Use to specify the events or statuses involved in a TemporalOrderingRelation.
usage_guideline.constraints: Typically links two distinct events or statuses to describe temporal ordering or overlap.

data_properties.name: occurredOnDate
data_properties.description: Specifies the date or date range when a PersonLifeEvent occurred.

usage_guideline.description: Use data property to record the date of a life event; consider date ranges by multiple events or statuses.
usage_guideline.constraints: Functional as only one primary date per event is recorded
